title: Preview: The Avengers #18
body:
The Avengers #18 preview. Who needs the Avengers when you’ve got the all-new Squadron Supreme of America? #comics #comicbooks

The Avengers #18

Jason Aaron (A/CA) Ed McGuinness
Rated T+
In Shops: Apr 24, 2019
SRP: $3.99

WAR OF THE REALMS TIE-IN!

See the greatest heroes of Washington, D.C., in action as the War of the Realms comes to the nation’s capital. Who needs the Avengers when you’ve got the all-new Squadron Supreme of America? But who are these mysterious new heroes, and where did they come from? Only Agent…

View On WordPress

blog.name: themannic
blog.title: The ManNic
blog.description: Two friends seeing life through geek tinted glasses!

title: Avengers: Endgame - Who will die?
body:
AVENGERS: ENDGAME is nearly upon us.  This mega-event is the 22nd movie in this shared universe, acting as the conclusion to the ‘Infinity Saga’, that started way back in 2008 with IRON MAN.

You just glimpse online and have to duck out of the way of a flying fan theory.  In fact, our latest podcast at The ManNic is looking at a few of those theories, as well as making our own predictions concerning the biggest movie of the year.

One rumbling rumour passing through the web, is that (POTENTIAL SPOILER AHEAD)…

… only TWO of the original six Avengers will make it out of the movie alive.  But which two???? Let’s have a think…

BLACK WIDOW

Now, the thing is, we know that Scarlett Johansson will be headlining her own BLACK WIDOW movie in the near future (presumably 2020) with casting already underway.   This might lead you to think that Russian assassin Natasha Romanoff will be safe.  However, I think we can expect the movie to be an origin story of sorts, seeing her in days before even working for SHIELD.   In fact I’d go as far as predicting, Nick Fury inducting her to the organisation will be towards the end of the movie (maybe even post-credits).  So I’m going to say that I think Black Widow will… DIE.

HAWKEYE

Or is it Ronin now?  Clint Barton was under house arrest during the events of INFINITY WAR, with the assumption that he returns to the team once his family are dusted from The Decimation.   Now it’s been a running joke that Barton isn’t quite equipped to fight aliens and robots as his fellow Avengers, and he’s certainly appeared less (just 3 movies + a cameo)… but I reckon Jeremy Renner might have a few more movies left on his contract.  Or, at least, even if ENDGAME does turn out to be his final outing (he’s got to be in BLACK WIDOW, right?) I think he’ll have a relatively happy ending.    Why do I think this?  Well, the key point here is, his family.  If we assume everyone that got dusted returns, then that includes his family.   They’re his little safe haven, and I think - whilst a load of characters won’t have happy endings, Marvel will want to preserve the family unit.   So I’m going to say Hawkeye will… SURVIVE.

I will say, I started with Nat and Clint because I instantly knew what my answer for those characters would be.  From this point is gets a little tricky.   And none is so tricky than…

HULK

You know, ask me a week ago and I’d have said Hulk would be one of the survivors. I mean, the Hulk is indestructible.  I was also under the impression that Mark Ruffalo had at least one more movie on his contract.   The thing is… where can they take the character from this point, to keep him fresh?  Dr Bruce Banner’s road in the MCU hasn’t been the smoothest.  THE INCREDIBLE HULK is almost the 'forgotten’ film within the franchise.  Edward Norton was recast after that movie, and the only other character to appear since has been Thaddeus Ross (played by William Hurt).  The movie is the only one not to receive a sequel, with the writers realising they could serve the character in an almost secondary role. In THOR: RAGNAROK, we found that the big green guy had been dominant on an alien landscape with 'puny' Banner only getting control one he’d fought Thor in a gladiatorial contest.   During INFINITY WAR, having taken a beating from Thanos, Banner couldn’t even get to emerge, and the ENDGAME posters are the first time Banner gets pictured rather than the Hulk.  Rumour is, the characters will come together and form a 'Professor Hulk’… basically the Hulk body with the intelligence of Banner. If that’s true… where do they take the character afterwards?  Maybe they don’t. As I mentioned, Hulk is pretty much indestructible, and if anyone, or anything can kill him it’ll be Thanos and the infinity stones… so maybe that’s what needs to happen. May - if you’re going to get rid of this character, the time is now.  

It’s entirely possible there’s some 'loophole’ here and actually they could kill of human Banner, whilst not killing of the Hulk, or vice versa.  But right now, if it’s all of nothing… I’m going to say Banner and Hulk will… DIE.

And now we move onto The Big Three.

CAPTAIN AMERICA

If ever there’s a character that’s expected to die, it’s Steve Rogers.  If we didn’t know he was going to be in INFINITY WAR, everyone would have assumed his time was up in CIVIL WAR (as per the comic).  I think a lot of us though he might buy it in INFINITY WAR, but are happy to see him reunited with Tony Stark for ENDGAME.  The thing is, though, Chris Evans has been quite public about this being his last movie in the franchise, hanging up his shield.   Now this doesn’t absolutely mean Rogers is done for.  In the comics, Steve’s old age catches up with him and he mentors Sam Wilson’s Falcon into being the new Captain America.  It’s possible the end of this movie might drain Cap so much, he emerges out of it now played by Clint Eastwood (or someone) meaning Evans is no longer needed, but the character can still be included. I think that’s a stretch though.  So, I’ll call it.  I think Steve Rogers will… DIE.

Okay… four down… two to go…

THOR

Chris Hemsworth has become a big name, largely thanks to playing Thor Odinson.  The first two THOR movies aren’t typically rated at the top of the franchise, but then THOR: RAGNAROK came along and revitalised the series.  Admittedly it did so by either leaving out, or killing, most of it’s main characters but I feel more Thor films could do well. Or even, just keep the character to pass the baton on to the next generation in a future AVENGERS movie. Hemsworth has also expressed interest in adding to his contract.  He’s also a god, you know?  Like Hulk, I’ve reversed my thoughts on his fate (I considered Thor to be on the out)… I’m now going to say Thor will… SURVIVE.

Which leaves us with…

IRON MAN

Robert Downey Jr started it all, and the Infinity Saga may just finish with him.  Word on the rumour mill suggests that part of the plot for SPIDER-MAN: FAR FROM HOME, will be Peter Parker dealing with the death of his mentor.  Indeed, Tony Stark has proven he can’t keep away from creating Iron Man suits, and this Avenging malarkey, so he’s unlikely to simply walk away.  I think the only way for the character to leave, is to leave this mortal coil.  I’m going to say Tony Stark will… DIE.

So there you go.   If we believe the rumour that only two will survive, then I’m saying Hawkeye and Thor.  But I’ve seen other rumours suggesting that they will all survive. 

What do you think?  Let us know in the comments, and for more hype in the lead up to AVENGERS: ENDGAME,  click the link to hear Liam and I make predictions concerning the movie… I cannot express how excited I am right now!

https://soundcloud.com/mannic-podcast/ep15-the-road-to-endgame

That link, just above, click that, you know you want to!

THOR

Chris Hemsworth has become a big name, largely thanks to playing Thor Odinson.  The first two THOR movies aren’t typically rated at the top of the franchise, but then THOR: RAGNAROK came along and revitalised the series.  Admittedly it did so by either leaving out, or killing, most of it’s main characters but I feel more Thor films could do well. Or even, just keep the character to pass the baton on to the next generation in a future AVENGERS movie. Hemsworth has also expressed interest in adding to his contract.  He’s also a god, you know?  Like Hulk, I’ve reversed my thoughts on his fate (I considered Thor to be on the out)… I’m now going to say Thor will… SURVIVE.

Which leaves us with…

IRON MAN

Robert Downey Jr started it all, and the Infinity Saga may just finish with him.  Word on the rumour mill suggests that part of the plot for SPIDER-MAN: FAR FROM HOME, will be Peter Parker dealing with the death of his mentor.  Indeed, Tony Stark has proven he can’t keep away from creating Iron Man suits, and this Avenging malarkey, so he’s unlikely to simply walk away.  I think the only way for the character to leave, is to leave this mortal coil.  I’m going to say Tony Stark will… DIE.

So there you go.   If we believe the rumour that only two will survive, then I’m saying Hawkeye and Thor.  But I’ve seen other rumours suggesting that they will all survive. 

What do you think?  Let us know in the comments, and for more hype in the lead up to AVENGERS: ENDGAME,  click the link to hear Liam and I make predictions concerning the movie… I cannot express how excited I am right now!

https://soundcloud.com/mannic-podcast/ep15-the-road-to-endgame

That link, just above, click that, you know you want to!
